member.name: N:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime
member.summary: The namespace contains classes related to the trprVSTOlong runtime. The main classes in the namespace provide programmatic access to the application manifest and cached data in the Runtime Storage Control of a Microsoft Office Word document or Microsoft Office Excel workbook. For more information, see Runtime Storage Control Overview.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AppManifest
member.summary: Represents the embedded application manifest in the Runtime Storage Control of a trprVSTOlong solution.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AppManifest.Clear
member.summary: Removes the contents of the application manifest.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AppManifest.FromXml(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the application manifest with information from an XML string.
member.param: The XML string to use to load the application manifest.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AppManifest.ToXml
member.summary: Returns the application manifest as an XML string.
member.returns: An XML string that contains the application manifest.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AppManifest.Dependency
member.summary: Gets information about the trprVSTOlong solution assembly.
member.returns: A that provides information about the trprVSTOshort solution assembly, including the name, version, and location of the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AppManifest.DeployManifestPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the full path to the deployment manifest for the trprVSTOlong solution.
member.returns: The full path to the deployment manifest for the trprVSTOshort solution; null if the the trprVSTOshort solution does not have a deployment manifest.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AppManifest.EntryPoints
member.summary: Gets the collection of entry points for the trprVSTOlong solution.
member.returns: An that contains the entry points for the trprVSTOshort solution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AppManifest.Identity
member.summary: Gets or sets information about the application manifest.
member.returns: An that provides information about the application manifest.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AssemblyIdentity
member.summary: Provides information about the application manifest or the assembly in a trprVSTOlong solution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AssemblyIdentity.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application manifest or the name of the solution assembly that the describes.
member.returns: The name of the application manifest or the solution assembly that the describes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AssemblyIdentity.PublicKeyToken
member.summary: Gets or sets a 16-character hexadecimal string that represents the last 8 bytes of the SHA-1 hash value of the public key under which the trprVSTOlong solution assembly is signed.
member.returns: A 16-character hexadecimal string that represents the last 8 bytes of the SHA-1 hash value of the public key under which the trprVSTOshort solution assembly is signed, if the represents a solution assembly that is signed with a strong name. Otherwise, an empty string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.AssemblyIdentity.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the application manifest or the version of the solution assembly that the describes.
member.returns: A that specifies the version of the application manifest or the version of the solution assembly that the describes.

member.summary: This exception is thrown when an attempt is made to start caching after the cache has already been loaded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ControlNotFoundException

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the cached type has changed since the last time it was saved.
member.returns: true if the cached type has been changed since it was last saved; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.InvalidDeployManifestException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when the deployment manifest that is referenced from the application manifest is not valid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.InvalidManifestException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when the manifest in the document is not valid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.InvalidNewApplicationManifestException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when the application manifest that is referenced from the deployment manifest is not valid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ItemAlreadyInCacheException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when an attempt is made to add an item to the cache in the document, but the item already exists in the cache.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ItemNotInCacheException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when an attempt is made to retrieve an item from the document's cache, but the item does not exist.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.MissingDataIdException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when a is saved while the cached data manifest contains a with an property that is null or an empty string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.MissingHostItemIdException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when a is saved while the cached data manifest contains a with an property that is null or an empty string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.MissingTypeException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when a is saved while the cached data manifest contains a with a property that is null or an empty string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.NonCacheableTypeException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when an attempt is made to cache a type, but the type is not a , , or a type that meets the requirements specified in Caching Data Objects.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.NoStartupObjectsException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when the main solution assembly does not contain a startup object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.NotAvailableOfflineException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when an attempt is made to call an assembly, but the assembly is not available in the cache or on the network.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.NotAvailableOnlineException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when an attempt is made to call an assembly, but the assembly is not available in the cache.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.RuntimeException
member.summary: Provides the base class for exceptions in the namespace.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ServerDocument
member.summary: Provides access to the cached data and the application manifest in a Microsoft Office Word document or Microsoft Office Excel workbook.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ServerDocument.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a path to the document to be loaded into the class.
member.param: A path to the document to be loaded into the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ServerDocument.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a byte array that represents the document to be loaded and a file name.
member.param: A file name, including the file type extension (for example, "Workbook1.xls").
A byte array that represents the document to be loaded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ServerDocument.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a stream that represents the document to be loaded and a file name.
member.param: A file name, including the file type extension (for example, "Workbook1.xls").
A that represents the document to be loaded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ServerDocument.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a path to the document to be loaded into the class and a value indicating whether to start Microsoft Office Word or Microsoft Office Excel.
member.param: A path to the document to be loaded into the class.
true to start Word or Excel; false to access the document without starting Word or Excel.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ServerDocument.#ctor(System.String,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a path to the document to be loaded into the class and a value indicating the file access allowed.
member.param: One of the values.
A path to the document to be loaded into the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ServerDocument.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a path to the document to be loaded into the class, a value indicating whether to start Microsoft Office Word or Microsoft Office Excel, and a value indicating the file access allowed.
member.param: One of the values.
A path to the document to be loaded into the class.
true to start Word or Excel; false to access the document without starting Word or Excel.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ServerDocument.AddCustomization(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new application manifest to the specified document.
member.returns: An XML string that contains the contents of the new application manifest.
member.param: The URL of the deployment manifest for the solution.
The path to the document that you want to customize.
The version of the application manifest, specifying the major version, minor version, build number, and revision number separated by periods (".").
The name of the customization assembly to attach to the document.
true to make all the paths in the application manifest relative to the document location; false to make all the paths absolute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.ServerDocument.Close
member.summary: Closes the document.

member.param: The path to the document that you want to check for customizations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Runtime.UpdateFailedException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when a deployment manifest references an application manifest that is a different version from the application manifest in the document, but the application manifest in the document cannot be updated.
